Accordions

We asked our experts,

“In your opinion, where are the best places for educators in Michigan to find jobs?”

To discover what our experts shared, select each expander to read more and hear what our experts had to say.


  • Job Posting Resources

    Our experts emphasized several places where prospective candidates can look for jobs, such as Frontline, district sites, ISD sites, as well as the Mistaff page. Please play the following short clip in which Alicia Ganaway, Walt Sutterlin, and Kelly Jones share their resources for job postings.


    Transcript

  • Further Considerations
      • If location is an important consideration, you may also find it helpful to visit the ISD websites of the locations you are near or where you are interested in working.

      • Another great resource for job searches is: Mistaff

      • Talking to others in your education network is a great way to learn about positions, as well.

    • Some details in job listings may make you think that you are not fully qualified for a position, but don’t select yourself out. If you are interested in and passionate about a position, apply! Be truthful in your application and let the employer determine for themselves whether you are a good fit.
